title: humanvelocity
author: humanvelocity
content: I have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: humanvelocity on February 06, 2023, 05:58:19 PMI have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,As written here, you'll need to get to 120 activity and 100 merit.The activity is not hard to earn, you'll find in this post (among other things) also how it's calculated. Basically you need to post a bit more.The merit is harder to get. You'll need to post things people find really useful so they'll merit your posts.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:02:07 PMQuote from: humanvelocity on February 06, 2023, 05:58:19 PMI have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,As written here, you'll need to get to 120 activity and 100 merit.The activity is not hard to earn, you'll find in this post (among other things) also how it's calculated. You could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie. Newbies Read before posting and you might as well find information there very useful.It's just surprising that you at OP whom have been here for a long time just don't know the means by which, users are ranked. Even with you after attaining the 3rd rank (member) in the ranking profiling of the forum. You ought to know this for real.Anyway, you get the merit and activity requirements then, you would be automatically moved to the next rank. As it is, your lacking in 90merits and 20activities for your next rank (Full member).

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Merit system was introduced in January 2018, you posted very well at the time, but you do not know how to rank up. That is ridiculous.Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:02:07 PMThe merit is harder to get. You'll need to post things people find really useful so they'll merit your posts.The more he provides what bitcointalk reputed users like, the merit will not be hard to get. I noticed the process can be slow, but even the people that receive merit like how snail is crawling are enjoying this forum.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.right85 on February 06, 2023, 06:07:50 PMYou could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie. Newbies Read before posting and you might as well find information there very useful.It's just surprising that you at OP whom have been here for a long time just don't know the means by which, users are ranked. Even with you after attaining the 3rd rank (member) in the ranking profiling of the forum. You ought to know this for real.If you would have bothered to click the links I've provided, you'd see that they contain the relevant information.Quote from: Charles-Tim on February 06, 2023, 06:08:05 PMMerit system was introduced in January 2018, you posted very well at the time, but you do not know how to rank up. That is ridiculous.Very good find!Quote from: Charles-Tim on February 06, 2023, 06:08:05 PMQuote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:02:07 PMThe merit is harder to get. You'll need to post things people find really useful so they'll merit your posts.The more he provides what bitcointalk reputed users like, the merit will not be hard to get. I noticed the process can be slow, but even the people that receive merit like how snail is crawling are enjoying this forum.If the information is useful, it will be merited sooner or later. Is it something else you've meant and I'm missing?I mean, yes, some areas tend to get merits easier than others. But I think that OP needs more than trying his luck here and there for 1-2 merits. Getting to 100 is quite a step.

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:17:44 PMQuote from: Mr.right85 on February 06, 2023, 06:07:50 PMYou could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie. Newbies Read before posting and you might as well find information there very useful.If you would have bothered to click the links I've provided, you'd see that they contain the relevant information.Sure I did. That's the reason for my "You could as well read..." statement to expose the user to not just the ranking profile requirements but other information that could prove useful to a newbie in the forum as, thats very much a pinned but over looked post, I know i did at a time and yet, it's some basic directive to forum functionality newbies should be aware of.Although, your thread cropped it just right just good, was on point and noted too.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.right85 on February 06, 2023, 06:46:26 PMAlthough, your thread cropped it just right just good, was on point and noted too.OK. Thanks for clarification.Since you've quoted me and wrote right afterwards "You could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie." I considered that you're referring to me.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: You have been here for a very long time, but in all that time you really haven't even posted all that much in the forum, that's not talking about the content of your posts you have now, but you have to be involved in the forum (through reading, posting and contributing) to earn 100 merits, you wouldn't just post sparingly and log in one day and see you have 100 merits now. Having said that, as far as the quality of your post goes, if you stick around like i have said and frequent sections that MS and users with merits go to, you'd stand a chance to slowly but surely earn merits and move up in the ranks.Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:49:25 PMSince you've quoted me and wrote right afterwards "You could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie." I considered that you're referring to me.Who would ever consider you a total newbie, lol

comments.author: Mr.right85
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on February 06, 2023, 06:49:25 PMQuote from: Mr.right85 on February 06, 2023, 06:46:26 PMAlthough, your thread cropped it just right just good, was on point and noted too.OK. Thanks for clarification.Since you've quoted me and wrote right afterwards "You could as well read the rules here to get some directives as you seem like a total newbie." I considered that you're referring to me.Lol.... naaah, my bad!I guess it was my quoting pattern that got this all wrong although, I took it to have featured your part mainly because of the links you already provided and provide what I felt could help as well. My apologies for the misconception.Perhaps I would look out more in course of my quotes next time and it's good you pointed it out as well. Your perception to my quoting pattern would definitely help and I got something out of this.Good enough, OP gets the idea to the requirements of the ranking profile now. Salute NeuroticFish!

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on February 06, 2023, 06:08:05 PMMerit system was introduced in January 2018, you posted very well at the time, but you do not know how to rank up. That is ridiculous.Newbies should be the ones asking this question, not a member who already rank up two ranks  it's obvious that you did not read the thread on how to rank up and you do not know how to use Bitcointalk's search form, you just exposed yourself as someone who disregards forum rules and all the other pieces of information related to members and forum activity its time to go back and check it so you will be guided on your activity here in Bitcointalk.

comments.author: Sandra_hakeem
comments.body: Quote from: humanvelocity on February 06, 2023, 05:58:19 PMI have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,...and then I get even more startled when I come across Post like this ... You mean you've been in this forum for over 5 years or so, and you don't Know what you could actually do to achieve 'em ranks? Shoulda rate this as some words outta fraustration of not getting 'em desires In the years past? Cus everything is repeated the same god-damn time in here..( and that has prolly been done more than a hundred times since your registration) what were your first motives in here?? ¬† I feel sad when I realize that "even though alot is done, it doesn't mean we are getting alot more done" ....So you're ready now, huh? I'm not seeing any chances but I just hope it works out for you. Makes quality post and keep them coming; YOUR STABILITY AND RESILIENCE IS WHAT WILL DEFINITELY EARN YOU A BETTER SPOT IN TOMORROW.....Sandra üßë‚Äçü¶∞

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Looking at your account creation time, I guess you were among the people who were airdropped equal merit to meet their current rank. I'm both new and old here, but if you just keep expressing yourself and contributing effectively, you'll be a full member before you know it. Though 100 merits aren't something you'll get in a day or two, they are something you'll get over time as a reward for adding something meaningful to the forum.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Welcome message and Satoshi's lesson can give you some valuable advice and motivation to start your journey.You have to learn and contribute for the forum community, then you will naturally rank up, not only to Full member but higher ranks.It is not easy to start but don't think that you will have to climb up a mountain and think that it is impossible. You can do it, like me and many others.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Mr.right85 on February 06, 2023, 09:08:45 PMLol.... naaah, my bad!No worries. As I said, I understood.Quote from: BlackBoss_ on February 07, 2023, 01:57:22 AMWelcome message and Satoshi's lesson can give you some valuable advice and motivation to start your journey.Well, OP has started his journey in 2017.So while he indeed seems to need such links, the wording "start your journey" is inaccurate

comments.author: reagansimms
comments.body: Quote from: humanvelocity on February 06, 2023, 05:58:19 PMI have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,This question should be asked by a newbie who just joined the forum. You have been registered since October 15, 2017, meaning you were here before the Merit system was introduced. After waking up from a long sleep, you immediately make a topic that in my opinion has no benefit at all, start reading more forum rules to find out how to promote to Full member.You also need to improve the quality of your posts to get more merit. After seeing some of the posts that you have made, it seems normal without any of them being considered quality. Start interacting on more visited Boards (Merit Source) by leaving some quality posts there.

comments.author: aysg76
comments.body: So you have registered before the merit system implementation and still asking for how to rank up to Full member on forum? If you care to look there are already lot of such threads explaining about it but you didn't care to look at them also.You have woke up after so many years of inactivity approximately 3 years as per BPIP report  and have earned not a single merit so what do you expect about ranking up on forum is easy for you? Just remain active and post some quality stuff if you really want to rank up as you are still 90 merits short to your target.

comments.author: puloweh555
comments.body: Quote from: aysg76 on February 07, 2023, 01:41:51 PMSo you have registered before the merit system implementation and still asking for how to rank up to Full member on forum? If you care to look there are already lot of such threads explaining about it but you didn't care to look at them also.You have woke up after so many years of inactivity approximately 3 years as per BPIP report  and have earned not a single merit so what do you expect about ranking up on forum is easy for you? Just remain active and post some quality stuff if you really want to rank up as you are still 90 merits short to your target.Yes it's true as you said. If we refer to the OP's account, he has been here for a long time. Supposedly if he is really consistent in making posts and continues to read every thread and understands what's in this forum he has now reached account rank Sr. Members are at least Full Members. The point is if you want to increase your account, you must contribute and be consistent in this forum.

comments.author: Doan9269
comments.body: Quote from: humanvelocity on February 06, 2023, 05:58:19 PMI have been part of Bitcoin talk forum for really long time now and yet I am still only a Member! Can someone please help or explain how this works? Thank you,You need to be active first, learn more about bitcoin understand the forum which start with you reading the rules and regulations guiding, each ranks has its own merits and activity requirements, meet their qualifications and ranking up is an automated thing which you don't beed to ask anyone for, you set the determination for your self having fulfilled the requirements, then you need to increase your post quality, this will allow your profile have a good look and members can finds it interesting to merit your oost on their will, now left to you to decide which path you want, vut i will advise you take all the advise and suggestions already given in this thread a d work by them, soon you may begin to see changes.

comments.author: armanda90
comments.body: You have been here more than last five years and seems impossible with your question about how to get promoted from member to be Full Member, due your account created before merit system adopted I don't think how come you not understand well new procedure for reaching higher level have merit points.Could acceptable if you not active in the Forum for longer time but you have read on beginner & help board for understanding what new rule for pushing account level. I think you will understand about how to get merits point by looking other account with higher level than your, check with their merit received and push your quality post for easy receiving merit points.

comments.author: Solosanz
comments.body: Quote from: puloweh555 on February 07, 2023, 02:11:25 PMYes it's true as you said. If we refer to the OP's account, he has been here for a long time. Supposedly if he is really consistent in making posts and continues to read every thread and understands what's in this forum he has now reached account rank Sr. Members are at least Full Members. The point is if you want to increase your account, you must contribute and be consistent in this forum.His activity isn't even enough become Full member, how he can rank up to Senior member. There are many users are have high activity but they only earn less than 100 Merits, it's because they're just joining a bounty campaign without contributing anything. The @OP doesn't need to think when he will rank up to next rank because it would force him to spam and then wouldn't get anything in the end. He may blame to anyone since they not give him sMerit.
